thread.title: Searsport runners participate in PVC championships
thread.title_full: Searsport runners participate in PVC championships

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Searsport runners participate in PVC championships
text:
Searsport runners participate in PVC championships Viking Catus 12th among 42 runners in girls varsity race By Staff | Oct 18, 2015 
Lincoln â€” A handful of Searsport District High School cross-country runners participated in the Penobscot Valley Conference small school championships on Saturday, Oct. 17 at Mattanawcook Academy 
The Vikings, who did not have five runners for the boys or girls to record team scores, crossed the three-mile course along with the other varsity and jayvee runners. 
The Vikings will participate in the Class C North regional championships on Saturday, Oct. 24 at Troy Howard Middle School in Belfast. The girls run at 1:20 p.m. and the boys at 1:55 p.m. 
At the league meet on Saturday, George Stevens Academy's John Hassett finished first in 16:14.28 for the 53 boys, while Orono's Tia Tardy placed first in 18:42.52 for the 42 girls. 
The individual SDHS boys varsity results were: 30, Devin Fairbrother, 20:33.90; 33, Holden Clapp, 20:45.09; and 53, Tony Yang, 28:50.55. 
The individual SDHS girls varsity results were: 12, Mary Brenna Catus, 21:36.14. 
The individual SDHS girls jayvee results (42 total runners) were: 28, Audrey Walker, 28:42.78. Courier Publications' sports staff can be reached by email at sports@villagesoup.com or by phone at 594-4401.
